conversation.content: Excuse me, are you using all six of these balls?
No no, just testing them out. I have this whole theory that bowling balls have personalities—you gotta find one that actually likes you. This purple one though? Total disaster.
That's... actually kind of brilliant. Mind if I join you? Lane seven's been broken for an hour.
Yeah, come on over! Fair warning though, I'm terrible. Like, impressively bad. I've hit other people's lanes twice tonight.
How do you even hit other people's lanes?
It's a gift, really. You need just the right amount of chaotic energy. Plus these rental shoes are definitely two different sizes—I swear they do it on purpose.
I haven't laughed like that in months. I'm Marcus.
[friendly] Sam. Thanks for not immediately fleeing when you saw my bowling form. Most people watch me wind up and suddenly remember they have somewhere urgent to be.
My wife used to say I bowled like I was angry at the pins.
Used to? Oh. Yeah, I— I get it. My ex and I came here every Thursday for three years. Now I come alone and terrorize innocent bowling balls.
Is that why you're here at eleven PM on a Tuesday?
Caught me. Tuesday nights the serious bowlers aren't here to judge. Plus Roberto, the night guy, he lets me have my emotional support nachos without the questions.
Emotional support nachos?
Absolutely. Bowl a gutter ball, that's one nacho. Strike in the wrong lane? Three nachos. And when you throw the ball backwards—which yes, has happened—you just eat the whole plate.
[very quickly] You threw a bowling ball backwards?
Okay so I was trying this YouTube technique and the ball was really slippery and physics just... abandoned me. Roberto still has the security footage. He watches it when he needs a laugh.
Can you teach me your chaos method?
Wait, you actually want to learn how to bowl badly? Because I've perfected magnificent failure here. Last week I knocked down exactly one pin the entire game. One. That takes dedication.
[short pause] Maybe I need some magnificent failure in my life right now.
Well then Marcus, let's do this. First rule—forget everything about proper form. Second rule—embrace the gutter, it's your friend now. And third? Always, always blame the rental shoes.
